turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Mosh Giant.
turn.1: What is the company Mosh Giant's main product?
turn.2: Mosh Giant Mosh is the BMX division of Giant Manufacturing Co.
turn.4: Ltd created in 1996 by Giant helped by Linn Kastan and AA Pro racer Jason Richardson.
turn.5: What is the company's most recent product?
turn.6: In 2002 Giant signed a 3-year sponsor deal with Satellite, a company that then managed the former GT Air Show, and began making Giant branded bikes in an effort to boost the Giant label and therefor making it an underground company to adapt the BMX market.
turn.7: What is the company's most important fact?
turn.8: Giant made bikes using the Mosh name until 2003 when it switched to Giant.
turn.9: Why did the company change from Mosh to Giant?
turn.10: Mosh is used to labeling all high end freestyle specific to street, skatepark and dirt riding and simply rename it MOSH PARTS. the mosh part and the Mosh team ATE managed independently from Giant Bikes.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: The team mostly changed in 2003 when the company decided to reposition itself in the market.
